messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Summer Mystery Reading Trip
messages.msgSnippet: ... And from the group description page at: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/LiteratureAlive/ ... Does this imply that either non-Christians never sign up or you
messages.messageBody:
On May 1, 2005, at 12:28 PM, Cay A. Gibson wrote:

> Booklovers, House of Literature has a Mystery Reading Trip planned
> this summer. Admission and travel expenses are all FREE!

And from the group description page at:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/LiteratureAlive/

> If you love literature, you are welcome here. No flaming will be
> allowed (especially concerning matters of faith). We are all
> Christians, and I trust that we will act as such.

Does this imply that either non-Christians never sign up or you really
aren't welcome once you're discovered not to be Christian?

Joyce

messages.subject: Summer Mystery Reading Trip
messages.msgSnippet: Booklovers, House of Literature has a Mystery Reading Trip planned this summer.  Admission and travel expenses are all FREE! Explanation and clues are found
messages.messageBody:
Booklovers, House of Literature has a Mystery Reading Trip planned
this summer. Admission and travel expenses are all FREE!

Explanation and clues are found at:
http://www.houseofliterature.com/id56.html

We have two winners already who have guessed the book location and the
selected book. They will receive a free copy of the book. Guesses
are now open at LA!
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/LiteratureAlive/

The book will be publicly announced here on May 10th!

Come join in the fun!
www.houseofliterature.com
